intro: Cylindropuntia stanlyi, commonly known as the Stanley's cholla, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are segmented and covered in spines, which provide protection from herbivores. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are pollinated by various insects and birds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert plains. Cylindropuntia stanlyi is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that plays an important role in desert ecosystems.
